page.title: 03Science and Technology
page.content: Humbly Grove Oil Field Development Exploration: Vibrocise technique gave seismic information showing possible carboniferous formations with Cap rock contours which could produce and trap hydrocarbons. Humbly Grove structure is an East-West trending Horst Block bounded north and south by major geological faults. Hydrocarbon bearing strata was in the Middle Jurassic limestone. Drilling: An exploration well drilled vertically down to 1400 metres found hydrocarbons in formation of variable permeability. Reservoir size 4km x 1km wide. Development: 14 wells drilled from 4 wellsites linked by 45km underground pipeline deliver oil to a gathering station at Weston Common. Stabilised crude oil goes by pipeline to terminal at Holybourne for transport to refinery. Production:2500 barrels per day low sulphur lightcrude
